result.execSummary:
The defendant Kathleen A. Finn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kathleen A. Finn

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Kathleen A. Finn, appeared with Attorney Christopher William Rose.  Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Amended Information filed; reading waived.  Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Misd Theft, of the amended info; found guilty by the court.  
Sentence:
2 days in the KCJ with 2 days sentence credit given.  Time served.  Court costs waived.  Appeal rights given.

Defendant, Kathleen A. Finn, appeared with Attorney Christopher W Rose.  Attorney Jason R Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, matter is resolved but needs a little more time.  Will be a misd plea and sentencing.  Matter set over, bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on June 20, 2014 at 10:00 am.
the 5/8/14 STC hrg has been adjourned at the request of the defense atty and to be resch'd.
